Message.Title: Dear President Obama
Message.Msg: This venerable and much honored WW II vet is well known in Hawaii for his seventy-plus years of service to patriotic organizations and causes all over the country. A humble man without a political bone in his body, he has never spoken out before about a government official, until now. He dictated this letter to a friend, signed it and mailed it to the president. Dear President Obama, My name is Harold Estes, approaching 95 on December 13 of this year. People meeting me for the first time don't believe my age because I remain wrinkle free and pretty much mentally alert. Sincerely, Harold B. Estes Snopes confirms as true: http://www.snopes.com/politics/soapbox/haroldestes.asp

Topic.Title: Strange chart pattern for T (not spam)

Message.Msg: I updated my spreadsheet last night and the 14,3,3 Slow Stochastic calculates as 77.39 (%K) and 79.90 (%D). Those numbers match exactly with Google Finance, Stockcharts, and the WSJ website. Yahoo Finance has different numbers. After changing the default 15,5 parameters to 14,3 the Slow Stochastic shows as 78.63 (%K) and 80.43 (%D). Yahoo Finance appears to be slightly off. I really wonder what they are doing differently. The difference is small but it could be significant if someone is trading real money on a Stochastic crossing below 80.
http://www.youtube.com/watch_popup?v=JVAhr4hZDJE&vq=medium#t=19* All American video. No scam,

Topic.Title: Strange chart pattern for T (not spam)

Message.Msg: I just discovered why the Stochastic on Yahoo Finance is different from most other sites. They smooth %K with an Exponential Moving Average rather than a Simple MA. Most sites use a 3 day simple moving average. Yahoo Finance uses a 5 day EMA which has a weighting of 0.3333 on the new data.

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ... “A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.” – Dwight D. Eisenhower, 1953 “Human history becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.” – H. G. Wells “Badnews for the Romneys. Ann Romney's horse Rafalka did not advance to the Olympic finals. Apparently it was beat by a smooth-talking socialist horse from Kenya." - Conan O'Brien “Bertrand Russell had given a talk on the then new quantum mechanics, of whose wonders he was most appreciative. He spoke hard and earnestly in the New Lecture Hall. And when he was done, Professor Whitehead, who presided, thanked him for his efforts, and not least for 'leaving the vast darkness of the subject unobscured'. “ – J. Robert Oppenheimer “The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves , but wiser people so full of doubts.” – Bertrand Russell "Romney's Olympic horse is named Rafalco. She said I needed a silly name that no one's ever heard of before and Mitt was taken." - Conan O'Brien “Knowledge will forever govern ignorance; and a people who mean to be their own governors must arm themselves with the power which knowledge gives.” – James Madison “With globalization mounting, the rules teaching us to live globally other than nationally are increasingly becoming meaningful.” – Tigran Sargsyan http://media.caglecartoons.com/media/cartoons/31/2012/08/10/116664_600.jpg “Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.” – Benjamin Franklin “I hate going to funerals because I’m not a mourning person.” – Jonathan Katz “We don't have to sacrifice a strong economy for a healthy environment. When we realize we can make a buck cleaning up the environment, it will be done!” – Dennis Weaver

Message.Title: AHQ (cont.)...
Message.Msg: ... “Change is the process by which the future invades our lives… Man remains in the end what he started as in the beginning: a biosystem with a limited capacity for change. When this capacity is overwhelmed, the consequence is future shock.” - Alvin Toffler “Music when healthy, is the teacher of perfect order, and when depraved, the teacher of perfect disorder.” – John Ruskin “You know the politicians aren’t great. But the voters are no prize either.” – Barney Frank “Reward excellent failures. Punish mediocre successes.” – Tom Peters “Wise are those who learn that the bottom line doesn't always have to be their top priority.” – William Arthur Ward "A former U.S. Olympic swimmer in an interview said that nearly all elite competitive swimmers pee in the pool regularly. So apparently I am an elite competitive swimmer." - Conan O'Brien “The most important political office is that of private citizen.” – Justice Brandeis http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yxNq05ukmuY “The best plan is no plan at all, then everything goes according to the plan.” – Jacek Bukowski “All religions are the same. Religion is basically guilt, with different holidays.” – Cathy Ladman “At the heart of science is an essential balance between two seemingly contradictory attitudes--an openness to new ideas, no matter how bizarre or counterintuitive they may be, and the most ruthless skeptical scrutiny of all ideas, old and new. This is how deep truths are winnowed from deep nonsense.” -- Carl Sagan

Message.Title: AHQ (3)...
Message.Msg: ... “The flower is the poetry of reproduction. It is an example of the eternal seductiveness of life.” – Jean Giraudoux “The trouble with law is lawyers.” – Clarence Darrow “I’m half Jewish and half Catholic. I used to bring a lawyer into confession.” – Bill Maher “The hour of departure has arrived, and we go our ways — I to die, and you to live. Which is better God only knows.” – Socrates “Politics and Religion are obsolete. The time has come for Science and Spirituality.” – Arthur C. Clark “Mitt Romney is claiming he’s going to create 12 million jobs in his first term. But he hasn’t said yet if he’ll create them in China or India.” – Conan O’Brien “Ever since I heard you is got a million dollars I notice you is fraught with perspicacity.” – Walt Kelly, through Uncle Baldwin “There is more selfishness and less principle among members of Congress, as well as others, than I had any conception of, before I became President of the U.S.” – James K. Polk. 1846 “An original idea. That can't be too hard. The library must be full of them.” – Stephen Fry “When one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.” – Lucius Annaeus Seneca
